result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin T Stevenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austin T Stevenson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austin T Stevenson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No threats/acts of violence against: anyone
Completion of DOC approved domestic violence treatment.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$543 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin T Stevenson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Austin T Stevenson in court.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 2. DISM cts 1, 3. 18 months probation. DE waives attorney. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to right to an attorney. Waiver accepted by Court.  Argument. DNA ordered.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1, 3  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   2
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, cs to 21CM1831

CONDITIONS:

-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone

-DOC Domestic Violence treatment
-Provide DNA sample

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 2
-DA surcharge: count 2
-All CC, DNA surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Bond posted to be applied to restitution, remainder to fines/cc. Return any balance to poster. 

-Days credit for time already served:  0
-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K

CORRECTION: 8/15/22 AT 3:17 pm
Case is cc to case 22CM1831
Becky K
Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Nancy B or Savannah H. 
Trial Judge - Br 11 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:29 AM Defendant appeared.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearances by victims. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victims.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
